Description: Body fragment of North Ionian black-figured Wild goat style pottery bowl; white slip. Inside glazed with two added red bands lined in white. Exterior, from top: front part of lion to right, facing a floral morif and further traces of an animal; band; frieze of hook maeander; band with probable added colour; metopal frieze with dotted concentric circles and verticals; glazed below.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the National Museum of Scotland. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.107)
CVA Edinburgh / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum National Museums of Scotland Edinburgh (p.4 and pl. 3, 17)
